history.content:
I don't think there is any specific course that deals only with graph theory. Also I have to disagree with 170 not being organized in terms of graph theory, that class is basically half graphs and is probably closest to what you want

---------------------------

270 does a good bit of spectral graph theory, really cool stuff. Between 70 and 170, all the basic stuff gets pretty much covered. If you're really into it, the keyword you want to be searching is "combinatorics" (a la Math 172).

---------------------------

Yeah 270 does a lot of graph theory

I don't think there is any specific course that deals only with graph theory. Also I have to disagree with 170 not being organized in terms of graph theory, that class is basically half graphs and is probably closest to what you want

---------------------------

270 does a good bit of spectral graph theory, really cool stuff. Between 70 and 170, all the basic stuff gets pretty much covered. If you're really into it, the keyword you want to be searching is "combinatorics" (a la Math 172).

I don't think there is any specific course that deals only with graph theory. Also I have to disagree with 170 not being organized in terms of graph theory, that class is basically half graphs and is probably closest to what you want

Is there a course about graph theory?

I found most graph theories are incorporated into courses, but we did not systematically learn them. CS170 covers some graph theory but not very organized.
history.subject: course on graph theory?
